intro.title: What is Steps to Podium?
intro.text1: Steps to Podium (S2P) creates unique, inspiring and educational content about the 2-wheeled Offroad world.
intro.text2: With S2P, you can learn how to improve your riding or take care of your bike, access gear reviews, discover the engineering behind our complex sport or follow Luis and his adventures as an amateur rider. Ready to join the ride?

offroadengineered.title: Offroad Engineered
offroadengineered.text: A series of educational and informative videos that explain in a simple and animated way, the engineering behind the dirt bikes we ride and the sport itself.

how-tos.title: How-to's
how-tos.text: Not everything needs to be complex. We have some very simple tips and tricks on how to take care of your bike or even for you to become a better rider.

reviews.title: Reviews
reviews.text: Looking for to buy new gear or parts? Here you’ll find a down-to-earth perspective on a bunch of products, so you can do a well-though and informed purchase.

races.title: Races
races.text: One of the best things about riding… is racing. You can follow the adventures of the S2P team and discover more about the Portuguese racing environment!

behindthescenes.title: Behind the Scenes
behindthescenes.text: In this segment, we'll tell you the story of your favorite Offroad brands and where they are headed, by interviewing people from inside the company.

interviews.title: Interviews
interviews.text: Steps to Podium allows Luis to have a deeper insight on the Offroad world by having interesting chats and interviews with key people from the Offroad community.

about.title: About Us
about.text: The whole idea was born during Luis’ Erasmus semester in Germany. Being deprived of riding dirt bikes, he realized how important the sport was to him. At that time, he was also watching a lot of YouTube videos, which made him realize that there was not much content specifically for the Offroad community. That was how Steps to Podium was born. In a funny, simple, and straightforward way, without any kind of interest or endorsement, Steps to Podium wants to inspire, teach and help amateur riders from around the globe.

aboutus.luis: Luís is a Mechanical Engineer that works in Software Development, and most important, is a dirt bike fanatic by heart. Luís’ love for the sport makes him seek nothing else but the complete understanding of the sport, whether it’s on the bike, off the bike or about the bike.
aboutus.lili: Lili is a Marketing expert that fell in love with the project (and probably Luis) and decided to help the brand grow and become global. She’s part of the team since the beginning, so she already knows a thing or two about dirt bikes, but don’t ask her too many questions.

contact.title: Get in touch
contact.text1: Do you have any tips, tricks, proposals or questions to share with us?
contact.text2: We’re very happy to hear from you! Leave us a message and we’ll reply as soon as possible.
contact.confirmmessage: Your email has been sent! We'll reply within 24 hours.

courses.text1: Whether you’re a weekend rider or a professional off-road rider, there is no doubt that your dirtbike's suspensions have a big impact on your overall comfort and performance.
courses.text2: If you've always wanted to know all the secrets of suspensions and how to adjust them to suit your needs, this is your chance. In our specialized courses, you will learn not only the theoretical foundations but also how to get your hands dirty and make your own adjustments
courses.texttestimonials: What our previous students have to say
courses.testimonial1: I used to tinker with the suspensions but it was never so extreme. Here, I realized exactly what impact it has on the bike, in terms of traction, for example. I learned a lot.
courses.testimonial2: It was fantastic. It was great to understand what the bike can and cannot do, how I can improve my times in the races, and to lose the fear of messing with the clicks.
courses.testimonial3: I think the two courses complement each other very well, and I would say that it is almost mandatory to do both, because it really makes a difference.
courses.testimonial4: I found this course very productive. It allows us to explore a lot of the click tunings and I think it's very important that we can do that. We can really feel all the sensations on top of the dirt bike.
courses.testimonial5: The atmosphere is very good. The fact that you have riders with different experiences sharing knowledge and discussing concepts that will later be experienced in practice is super interesting. It's not just content that can be read anywhere, it's truly feeling and understanding how things work.
courses.testimonial6: This is great. All people should know what compression and rebound means, or what is high or low speed... and the influence of these adjustments when riding, in terms of comfort [for the rider].
courses.testimonial7: This is very good for people to be comfortable in experimenting and understand how a suspension or shock absorber works. Hearing the explanation of what each tuning does and then realizing what it conveys or what allows us to do in practice, is super important.

forks.textthecourse1: Nowadays, suspensions can be adjusted in several ways, considering your weight, the type of terrain or riding and other variables. Well adjusted suspensions will undoubtedly have an impact on your performance - but also on your comfort and safety while riding.
forks.textthecourse2: However, few riders are able to go “beyond the clicks” and, in fact, understand exactly how to take full advantage of their suspensions. In this course, you will learn to adjust your suspensions to your liking - and more
forks.whatyouwilllearn1: How suspensions work and how they are built
forks.whatyouwilllearn4: How to adjust your suspensions to your needs
forks.textextras3: Special price for maintenance or revision of your suspensions by Steps to Podium
forks.textextras4: 10% discount in all Steps to Podium courses
forks.textrequirements1: To do this course, your bike's front forks have to be equipped with low-speed compression damping and low-speed rebound damping adjusters.
forks.textrequirements2: To really take advantage of this course, your suspensions must be in good condition and with maintenance up to date. You should also bring a small screwdriver to adjust your suspension adjusters.
forks.textisthisforme2: If you've made it this far, we have no doubt that this course is for you. This course was prepared for all of those who want to learn more about suspensions and the impact they can have on the experience of riding a dirtbike, regardless of the rider's level of experience.
forks.textweekendwarrior: Since “you only go for a few rides from time to time”, you may be thinking that learning to adjust your suspensions is not worth it. You're wrong. Knowing how to fine-tune your suspensions will not only help you save some money, but will also greatly improve your experience on the bike. You will be prepared to take advantage of them at all times: from easy rides to more challenging trails.
forks.textamateurpro1: Saving some money and improving performance are two of the best things in life for any amateur rider (we know it well!). Learning how to tune and adjust your suspensions to your liking will allow you both. In addition to learning more about suspensions and how they work, you will be able to learn to adjust them according to the needs of each race, so that you are everytime closer to the podium.
forks.textamateurpro2: So, what are you waiting for?
forks.textsigningup1: To sign up for this course, fill out the form below.
forks.textsigningup2: After submitting the form, you will receive an email with the payment information, so you can guarantee your place. Your registration is only valid after the payment has been validated.
forks.textsigningup3: Once your registration is considered valid, you will receive an email with everything you need to know to join us.
forks.textsigningup4: Any questions or doubts, please contact us at stepstopodium@gmail.com.

shock.textthecourse1: The rear shock might be the most important component on a dirt bike. Not only it absorbs the bumps of the terrain, it also has to help transfer the power to the ground. A well adjusted shock will undoubtedly have an impact on your performance - but also on your comfort and safety while riding.
shock.textthecourse2: However, few riders are able to really understand the difference between high-speed and low-speed compression damping and, in fact, understand exactly how to take full advantage of the rear shock. In this course, you will learn to adjust your shock to your liking - and more
shock.textthecourse3: Note: If you haven't done any of S2P suspension courses, we recommend doing first the Front Forks course, as it will better prepare you for the Rear Shock course.
shock.whatyouwilllearn1: How a shock works and how it's built
shock.whatyouwilllearn4: How to adjust your shock to your needs
shock.textextras3: Special price for maintenance or revision of your suspensions by Steps to Podium
shock.textextras4: 10% discount in all Steps to Podium courses
shock.textrequirements1: To do this course, your bike has to be equipped with low-speed and high-speed compression damping and low-speed rebound damping adjusters.
shock.textrequirements2: To really take advantage of this course, your shock must be in good condition and with maintenance up to date. You should also bring a small screwdriver to adjust your shock's adjusters.
shock.textisthisforme2: If you've made it this far, we have no doubt that this course is for you. This course was prepared for all of those who want to learn more about rear shocks and the impact they can have on the experience of riding a dirtbike, regardless of the rider's level of experience.
shock.textweekendwarrior: Since “you only go for a few rides from time to time”, you may be thinking that learning to adjust your shock is not worth it. You're wrong. Knowing how to fine-tune your shock will not only help you save some money, but will also greatly improve your experience on the bike. You will be prepared to take advantage of them at all times: from easy rides to more challenging trails.
shock.textamateurpro1: Saving some money and improving performance are two of the best things in life for any amateur rider (we know it well!). Learning how to tune and adjust your shock to your liking will allow you both. In addition to learning more about shocks and how they work, you will be able to learn to adjust them according to the needs of each race, so that you are everytime closer to the podium.
shock.textamateurpro2: So, what are you waiting for?
shock.textsigningup1: To sign up for this course, fill out the form below.
shock.textsigningup2: After submitting the form, you will receive an email with the payment information, so you can guarantee your place. Your registration is only valid after the payment has been validated.
shock.textsigningup3: Once your registration is considered valid, you will receive an email with everything you need to know to join us.
shock.textsigningup4: Any questions or doubts, please contact us at stepstopodium@gmail.com.

techsession.text1: Do you have any doubts regarding your dirt bike suspensions? Would you like to learn how to do basic maintenance or how to tune the engine? Do you need support preparing for a race? We can help.
techsession.text2: Schedule a 30-minute or 1-hour technical session, depending on what you need, and we'll help clear up all your queries.
techsession.accordionbooktitle: How does it work and how do I schedule it?
techsession.accordionbookstep1: Fill out the form below, including in the message field all the questions or topics you would like to see addressed; and with a date/time suggestion.
techsession.accordionbookstep2: We will contact you to verify all information and confirm the proposed date/time or arrange an alternative date.
techsession.accordionbookstep3: After everything is arranged between us, we will send you the login details for the session, which takes place online.
techsession.accordionbooktext2: If you have any questions, you can contact us at
techsession.accordiontimetext2: If you want to clarify a specific question about a topic that you already master or if you are just looking for a more general knowledge about a certain subject, 30 minutes is enough. To clarify various doubts, approach a topic in detail or learn how to practice some processes, 60 minutes is ideal.
techsession.accordiontimetext3: In both sessions, if justified, we will help you to “get your hands dirty”.

register.title: Signing up
register.text: Sign up now and save your spot
register.textprivatecourse1: Are you looking for an individual session? Do you want to take the course only with your group of friends or your team? We can help.
register.textprivatecourse2: For more information about private courses, fill out the form above or contact us at stepstopodium@gmail.com.

meta.maintitle: Steps to Podium: Your offroad community
meta.maindescription: Learn how to improve your riding or take care of your bike, access bikes and gear reviews, and discover the engineering behind our sport with Steps to Podium.
meta.coursesdescription: Do you want to learn all the secrets of your motorcycle's suspensions and how to make your own adjustments, besides tuning the “clicks”? Sign up for one of our courses!
meta.forkscoursestitle: Steps to Podium: Dirt bike Front Forks Course
meta.forkscoursesdescription: Do you want to learn all the secrets of your motorcycle's suspensions and how to make your own adjustments, besides tuning the “clicks”? Sign up for one of our courses!
meta.shockcoursestitle: Steps to Podium: Dirt bike Rear Shock Course
meta.shockcoursesdescription: Do you want to learn all the secrets of your motorcycle's rear shock and how to make your own adjustments, besides tuning the “clicks”? Sign up for one of our courses!
meta.techsessionstitle: Steps to Podium: Technical Support Sessions
meta.techsessionsdescription: If you have any doubts regarding the maintenance or the mechanics of your dirtbike, or even other related topics, we can help. Schedule your technical session!
